page.title: 04SHEEP FARMING IN ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: On the hill farms of Eskdalemuir cattle as well as sheep are raised in substantial numbers,partially wintered indoors during the extremely cold months. The main breed,the Black Galloway is mated to a White Shorthorn bull producing Blue grey calves.Fewer in number are Friesian heifers mated to the Hereford bull. There is little or no grain harvest . Hay and silage are procured weather permitting. Technology plays a major part in the mechanised method of farming in the 1980's.Rotavators break up the soil,harrows level the ground.The spinner broadcaster sews grass seed and fertiliser.The turbo-mower cuts the grass the haybob teds and reaps. The baler-handler takes in the bales .The tractor is the heart of this.
